definition: to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: The calculation of damages is same as the said penalties collected from the borrower.
sentences.chinese: 違約金數額的計算應與加收借款方的罰息計算相同。

sentences.english: What is the nature of the liquidated damages?
sentences.chinese: 勞動合同違約金的性質如何？

sentences.english: The amount of penalty for breach of contract shall not be in excess of the training fees as provided by the employer.
sentences.chinese: 違約金的數額不得超過用人單位提供的培訓費用。

sentences.english: A default would be an ever bigger damage.
sentences.chinese: 違約金將是一個更大的數目。

sentences.english: Every day of delay, payment by the defaulting party the other two thousandths of the penalty.
sentences.chinese: 每逾期一日，由違約方給付對方千分之二的違約金。

sentences.english: If you default on payments, it is your personal credit history that is hurt.
sentences.chinese: 如果你違約金，這是你個人信用歷史就是傷害。

definition: to be reimbursed for actual expenses
to pay sb else's expense with the expectation of being reimbursed by that person later
to replace a purchase/to exchange a purchase
to break a promise/breach of contract
